poem:
**Symmetry of Thought**

A two-word time capsule, Heinlein's muse,
speaks in tongues of Tom, his steps infused
with forwards back, a palindrome's kiss,
a word-locked dance, a quiz's abyss.

In summer's bright, fiendish riddles spin,
through loops of lore, they twist and grin,
answers reflecting a mirrored sky,
each solving touch a gentle pry.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Can you face Frank Paul’s fiendish summer quiz? Palindrome The eight answers in this round form a palindrome. That is to say, if the answers are seen collectively as a single string of letters (disregarding spaces, punctuation and capitalisation), it will read the same forwards and backwards. 1 Which two-word term was popularised by a 1948 Robert Heinlein novel of the same name, which inspired a science fiction franchise centring on a character named Tom". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
